Name and/or number of field, block or deposit

annotations.text: Makeni, Bombali district
annotations.category: Location, longitude and latitude /  Onshore vs Offshore (shallow vs. deep)

annotations.text: Makeni
200 million Euro in Phase I (2010-2013); 300 million Euro in Phase II (2013-2015)
Distiller capacity of 350 KLpd and power co-generation capacity 15 MW in Phase I; Distillery capacity of 700 KLpd and power co-generation capacity 30 MW in Phase II
Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone Ltd, Addax & Oryx Holdings BV
annotations.category: Name of company executing the document and composition of the shareholders

annotations.text: The Government of the Republic of Sierra Leone acting by the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Food Security; the Ministry of Energy and Water Resources; the Ministry of Finance and Economic Development; and the Ministry of Trade and Industry
annotations.category: State agency, national company, ministry executing the document

annotations.text: Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Food Security; the Minister of Energy and Water Resources; the Minister of Finance and Economic Development; and the Minister of Trade and Industry

annotations.category: Name and/or composition of the company created or anticipated
Name of third party to contract (where applicable)

annotations.text: 5 years, ending in 2015
Sugarcane
annotations.category: Type of resources (mineral type, crude oil, gas, timber, etc.) OR specific crops planned (ex:  food crops, oil palm, etc.)

annotations.text: Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone will build and improve social infrastructure

annotations.category: Protection of sacred locations, resources and environment

annotations.text: Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone has negotiated land lease agreements covering the project area with the district office, chiefdom councils and landowners of Bombali district
Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone will seek to improve the livelihoods of the local population by employing and/or contracting up to 4,000 staff and training its workforce

Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone agrees to permit tendering by local suppliers of relevant ancillary services, such as warehousing, packaging, engineering and shipping, from time to time and on the company's reasonable conditions
Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone  will seek to improve the livelihoods of the local population by establishing a smallholder and outgrower support scheme
annotations.category: Outgrowers Program (details, additional land provided, etc)

annotations.text: Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone will comply with national standards in relation to health and safety
annotations.category: Requirements regarding workers or farm/concession dwellers within concession areas or in nearby communities in respect of occupational health and safety, access to clean water, housing, medical care, or education
Physical security, protection of property, and/or use of guards
Grievance mechanisms for non-contractual harms to non-contracting parties
Rights of non-contracting parties to access/use concession area (including permitted independent farming in concession area)

annotations.text: Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone is exempt from corporate income tax for income received or accrued prior to 31 December 2022
Any losses accrued up until 31 December 2022 cannot be carried forward beyond 2022

annotations.category: Production Share - "Cost Oil" features  (basis of calculation, limits on cost recovery - e.g. as % of revenue or production, capex uplift, etc.)
Production Share - "Profit Oil" features  (triggers for variations in split - IRR, "r" factor, production, etc.)
Service Agreement - Fee to developer / contractor (basis for calculation)

annotations.text: Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone can claim tax deductions in respect of depreciation of its capital assets of the project over a 20-year period from the date of commencement of commercial operations of the project

Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone is to deduct withholding tax at a reduced rate of 5% from interest payments, subject Annex, art. 9(d). Rent payments by Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone in connection with land leases and rights, as well as other bona fide business payments and expenses, are deductible for corporate tax purposes and not subject to any withholding tax.
Agricultural inputs imported by Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone are not subject to any tax or duty whatsoever

annotations.category: Fixed fee for grant and renewal of license
Restrictions on transactions with affiliated parties

annotations.text: The project will be based on the Environmental, Social, and Health Impact Assessment. The Environmental License for the project is granted to Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone subject to the Impact Assessment being implemented to a material extent.
annotations.category: Social, environmental and/or human rights impact assessments, as well as related management plans
Social, environmental and/or human rights monitoring requirements

annotations.text: Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone is charged a fixed rate of 3 Leone per cubic meter of water used under a water rights agreement
annotations.category: Right to take and/or use water within/near contract concession area (including fees, licenses, and permits required)
Other requirements regarding protection of the environment (including prevention of pollution and watercourse protection)

annotations.text: Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone has finalized technical and environmental studies which confirmed the feasibility of the project in terms of soil quality, climate, environmental conditions, and transport and transmission logistics
annotations.category: Feasibility studies and requirement of business plan
Marketing of output and state access to output
Contracting party's permitted use of public or private land outside concession area

annotations.text: All disputes are to be resolved under the Rules of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce
annotations.category: Governing law in case of dispute

annotations.text: All disputes are to be resolved by arbitration and referred to arbitration in London, before three arbitrators. Each party can select an arbitrator, with the third agreed upon, or nominated by the two appointed arbitrators, or by the ICC Court of Arbitration. Proceedings are to be in English. Appeal rights are waived. The arbitration award is to be final and binding.
The tax provisions listed apply to all present and future taxes. Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone may be exempted from any change in law which has a material adverse effect on the project.
ENG

annotations.category: Reporting Requirements and other methods of monitoring compliance

annotations.text: The Government will not nationalize, expropriate, or confiscate Addax Bioenergy Sierra Leone's or its contractors' assets without full compensation, including loss of profit
The provisional business plan is not attached to the Memorandum
